headline: Heard on the Street Recap: A Chrome-Plated Rally
summary: What Happened in Markets Today Tech shares rallied. The Nasdaq Composite rebounded 1% on Wednesday, and the S&P 500 added 0.5%. The Dow Jones Industrial Average, however, shed a slim 24 points. A reprieve for Google sparked the jump.

headline: Dollar Tree Posts Better-Than-Expected Earnings. Why the Stock Is Falling Sharply.
summary: Dollar Tree  posted strong fiscal second-quarter earnings but the stock slumped on the back of an underwhelming third-quarter forecast.  Adjusted earnings in the second quarter of 77 cents a share topped the consensus estimate of 42 cents.  Dollar Tree hiked its fiscal-year net sales guidance to a range of $19.3 billion to $19.5 billion, from $18.5 billion to $19.1 billion.

content.title: Dollar Tree Posts Better-Than-Expected Earnings. Why the Stock Is Falling Sharply.
content.summary: Dollar Tree  posted strong fiscal second-quarter earnings but the stock slumped on the back of an underwhelming third-quarter forecast.  Adjusted earnings in the second quarter of 77 cents a share topped the consensus estimate of 42 cents.  Dollar Tree hiked its fiscal-year net sales guidance to a range of $19.3 billion to $19.5 billion, from $18.5 billion to $19.1 billion.

headline: Dollar Tree Raises Outlook But Tariff Pressures Spark Investor Selloff
summary: Dollar Tree Inc. (NASDAQ:DLTR) shares fell on Wednesday after the discount retailer posted stronger-than-expected second-quarter sales and earnings, as margin pressures from tariffs and a cautious profit outlook tempered investor sentiment. The discount retailer’s second-quarter sales increased 12.3% to $4.567 billion, beating the consensus of $4.484 billion. Same-store net sales increased 6.5%, driven by a 3% increase in traffic and a 3.4% increase in average ticket. Gross profit increased 12.9

(NASDAQ:DLTR) shares fell on Wednesday after the discount retailer posted stronger-than-expected second-quarter sales and earnings, as margin pressures from tariffs and a cautious profit outlook tempered investor sentiment. The discount retailer’s second-quarter sales increased 12.3% to $4.567 billion, beating the consensus of $4.484 billion. headline: Dollar Tree's Q3 profit hit by tariff shock despite steady demand
summary: (Reuters) -Dollar Tree forecast current-quarter profit below estimates on Wednesday as tariffs drive up costs for the retailer, although it expects demand to be steady as Americans  hunt for more affordable products at its stores.  Dollar Tree's shares, which have jumped about 50% this year, fell about 10% in early trading.  U.S. President Donald Trump's import tariffs have squeezed margins for retailers that are looking to keep prices low for value-seeking consumers, amplifying challenges for businesses navigating increased uncertainty and sticky inflation.

content.title: Dollar Tree's Q3 profit hit by tariff shock despite steady demand
content.summary: (Reuters) -Dollar Tree forecast current-quarter profit below estimates on Wednesday as tariffs drive up costs for the retailer, although it expects demand to be steady as Americans  hunt for more affordable products at its stores.  Dollar Tree's shares, which have jumped about 50% this year, fell about 10% in early trading.  U.S. President Donald Trump's import tariffs have squeezed margins for retailers that are looking to keep prices low for value-seeking consumers, amplifying challenges for businesses navigating increased uncertainty and sticky inflation.

headline: Dollar Tree outdoes Q2 estimates, disappoints on guidance
summary: Discount retailer Dollar Tree (DLTR) takes a hit in Wednesday pre-market trading, its stock falling despite topping second quarter earnings and revenue estimates and boosting its full-year outlook. Yahoo Finance retail reporter Brooke DiPalma comes on The Morning Brief to talk more about the chain's guidance and investor reactions. Also watch Brooke DiPalma's assessment of Macy's (M) strong earnings report and raised guidance. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Google avoids breakup, bonds, Macy's & Dollar Tree: 3 Things
summary: Alphabet's Google (GOOG, GOOGL) won't have to divest and sell off its Chrome browser business, according to a federal judge's ruling in the tech giant's antitrust case. Investors eyes are on the bond market (^TYX, ^TNX, ^FVX) as the 30-year Treasury yield nears 5%. Major retailers Macy's (M) and Dollar Tree (DLTR) posted their second quarter earnings results. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

Major retailers Macy's (M) and Dollar Tree (DLTR) posted their second quarter earnings results.

headline: Dollar Tree shares drop despite Q2 beat
summary: Investing.com -- Dollar Tree, Inc. reported second-quarter earnings that significantly exceeded analyst expectations, driven by strong comparable store sales growth and improved margins. However, the stock fell more than 9% at the open on Wednesday.

headline: Dollar Tree (NASDAQ:DLTR) Beats Q2 Sales Expectations, Full-Year Outlook Slightly Exceeds Expectations
summary: Discount treasure-hunt retailer Dollar Tree (NASDAQ:DLTR) reported Q2 CY2025 results beating Wall Street’s revenue expectations, but sales fell by 38.1% year on year to $4.57 billion. The company’s full-year revenue guidance of $19.4 billion at the midpoint came in 1.3% above analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.77 per share was 87.6% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: Dollar Tree (NASDAQ:DLTR) Beats Q2 Sales Expectations, Full-Year Outlook Slightly Exceeds Expectations
content.summary: Discount treasure-hunt retailer Dollar Tree (NASDAQ:DLTR) reported Q2 CY2025 results beating Wall Street’s revenue expectations, but sales fell by 38.1% year on year to $4.57 billion. The company’s full-year revenue guidance of $19.4 billion at the midpoint came in 1.3% above analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.77 per share was 87.6% above analysts’ consensus estimates.
